sentences.sentence: The Birthday of the Infanta( 公主 )
It was the birthday of the Infanta( 公主 ).
She was just twelve years old, and the sun was shining brightly in the gardens of the palace.
Although she was a real Princess( 公主 ) and the Infanta( 公主 ) of Spain( 西班牙，地名 ), she had only one birthday every year, just like the children of quite poor people.
So it was of course very important to the whole country that she should have a really fine day for the occasion.
And it certainly was a really fine day.
The Tulips( 郁金香 ) stood straight up, and looked boldly( 大胆自信地 ) across the grass at the Roses, and said, “We are just as lovely as you are now.”
The purple butterflies( 蝴蝶 ) flew by with gold dust( 粉尘 ) on their wings, and visited each flower one by one.
The little Lizards( 蜥蜴 ) came out of the holes in the wall, and pleasantly warmed themselves in the white sunlight.
The little Princess( 公主 ) herself walked through the garden with her friends, and played hide and seek( 捉迷藏 ) around the trees and the old statues( 雕像 ).
On ordinary days she was only allowed to play with other princes( 王子 ) and princesses( 公主 ), and so she very often had to play alone.
But today was her birthday, and so the King had made an exception,
and the Infanta( 公主 ) had been allowed to invite any of her young friends to come and play with her.
Most of them were Spanish( 西班牙的 ) children, and they had all been dressed in their finest clothes.
The boys all wore colorful loose( 宽松的 ) coats and hats with feathers( 羽毛 ),
while the girls wore long dresses sewn with( 缝有...的 ) flower patterns( 图案 ), and carried large fans of black and silver.
But the Infanta( 公主 ) was the best-dressed of all, and wore the finest clothes.
Her robe( 礼袍 ) was made of grey silk, and her dress was silver, and she wore a tight( 紧身的 ) jacket covered with rows of fine pearls( 珍珠 ).
Two tiny shoes with big pink roses on top appeared from under her dress as she walked.
Her large fan was pink and white, and her hair was like a ring of( 一圈 ) golden light around her pale little face,
and in her hair she wore a beautiful white rose.
From a window in the palace the sad King watched them.
Behind him stood his brother, whom he hated, and his priest( 神父 ).
The King was even sadder than usual, because as he looked at the Infanta( 公主 ) playing and laughing,
he thought of the young Queen, her mother.
It had only been a short time before, or so it seemed to him, that the Queen had come from France.
Less than two years later, and just six months after she had given birth to( 生下 ) the Infanta( 公主 ), the Queen had died.
The King had loved her so greatly that he would not allow even the grave( 坟墓 ) to hide her from him.
He had ordered her body to be preserved( 保存 ), and then placed in the palace cathedral( 大教堂 ), where she had lain for the past twelve years.
Once every month the King went to the cathedral( 大教堂 ), and stood by her side calling out, “My Queen! My Queen!”
Sometimes he could not control his heartache( 心痛 ), and he would even kiss her face, and try to wake her with his mad kisses.
Looking at the Infanta( 公主 ) today, he seemed to see the Queen again,
just as he had first seen her at the palace of the French King.
He had been only fifteen years old then, and she had been even younger.
They had been engaged( 订婚 ) to be married on that occasion,
and before he had returned to Spain( 西班牙，地名 ) she had given him a little ring of her yellow hair, and a kiss on his hand as she said goodbye.
Later on they had gotten married, with a short wedding( 婚礼 ) at a small town near the border( 边境 ) of the two countries,
and then a larger ceremony( 仪式 ) when they had returned to Madrid( 马德里，地名 ).
Certainly he had loved her madly, and some thought perhaps a little too much.
At the time, Spain( 西班牙，地名 ) had been at war with England, but the King seemed to forget all about this.
All he cared about was the Queen, and he did everything he could to make her happy, and appeared to no longer care about his duties as the King.
When she died, he was like a man who had completely lost his mind.
In fact, he thought seriously about giving up his title( 头衔 ) of King to his brother.
He only decided to stay as King because he did not trust his brother, who was well-known for his cruelty( 残暴 ), and might do something to hurt the Infanta( 公主 ).
He remained as the King, but even after several years had passed, he was still so heart-broken that he would not even consider marrying again.

question.cn: 公主平时可以和朋友们玩耍吗？
question.en: Could the Infanta play with her friends during ordinary days?

analysis: 文中提到“The little Princess herself walked through the garden with her friends, and played hide and seek around the trees and the old statues. On ordinary days she was only allowed to play with other princes and princesses, and so she very often had to play alone. ”公主平时不可以和朋友玩耍，因此选B。

options.cn: 因为他意识到时光飞逝。
options.en: Because he realized how fast time passes.

options.cn: 因为他想起了他深爱的王后。
options.en: Because he thought of the Queen who he loved deeply.

analysis: 文中提到“The King was even sadder than usual, because as he looked at the Infanta playing and laughing, he thought of the young Queen, her mother. ”因此本题选C。
